plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its stunning springtime display of pale pink to white flowers. These blossoms symbolize the transient nature of life in Japanese culture and attract visitors to cherry blossom festivals globally.
plants.funFact: The Japanese Cherry Blossom blooms for only about one to two weeks, creating a highly anticipated seasonal event known as Hanami.

plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with large clusters of funnel-shaped flowers, often purple or pink. It thrives in acidic soils and is widely naturalized in parts of the UK and Ireland.
plants.location: Native to Southern Europe and Western Asia; naturalized in UK
plants.funFact: Pontic Rhododendron spreads rapidly and can form dense thickets, sometimes outcompeting native vegetation.

plants.name: California Poppy
plants.description: The state flower of California, this annual plant produces vibrant orange to yellow cup-shaped flowers. It opens in the morning sunlight and closes at night or on cloudy days.
plants.funFact: California Poppies are drought-tolerant and can quickly colonize disturbed ground, making them important for erosion control.

plants.name: Magnolia x soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia with large, fragrant pink to purple flowers that bloom before the leaves emerge, marking one of the first signs of spring in temperate gardens.
plants.funFact: The Saucer Magnolia was developed in France in the 19th century as a hybrid between two Asian magnolia species.
